channel.title: virtualization on Yak Shaving
channel.description: Recent content in virtualization on Yak Shaving

item.title: Thick Provisioning vs Thin Provisioning
item.description: When you create a virtual machine, you have to elect storage, and you have two options, thick and thin, so what are thick provisioning and thin provisioning, and how they differ.

item.title: Virtual Machine Files
item.description: Virtual machine itself consists of multiple files that reside on the data store itself. Global virtual machine files.

item.title: Limit CPU Features to Virtual Machine
item.description: You can mask some of the CPU features to not be exposed to the virtual machine; a common example is “AMD No eXecute (NX)” and “Intel eXecute Disable (XD)”.

item.title: Hyper Threading
item.description: Hyper-threading (HT) is a proprietary technology developed by Intel that boosts the parallelization of computations carried out on x86 processors.

item.title: What Is Esxi Host
item.description: ESXi host is the actual physical server that the virtual machines will run on. ESXi is the operating system that we install on this physical server.

item.title: Software Defined Data Center SDDC
item.description: What is software-defined data center? The software-defined data center approach extends industry-leading virtualization beyond computing, network and storage, making data center services painless in terms of configuration and managing virtual machines.
